page.title: 02Small Farm, North Lopham
page.content:
There are many small farms in our area. One example is in North Lopham, on the road to East Harling. The owners are Mr. and Mrs. Callow, who have owned the farm for seventeen years. They work the farm themselves, with only casual workers to help with harvesting and lifting potatoes. They farm 26 acres, some of it owned and some of it rented. They farm it very intensively.
The Callows enjoy living and working in North Lopham. They say working on a small farm is hard, but rewarding work. You need to be prepared to work all hours, but they are content. They hope to buy more land to make their farm bigger and also hope to pass it on to their twin boys, now aged 13. (See also page 3)
